website_summaries.verdict: Stands out for its spacious, rugged design and superb performance. A solid investment for your garden.
pros: Operates smoothly and retains heat for year-round composting
Dual chambers provide 70 gallons of space
cons: It's pricey, and assembly is time-consuming

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY  GARBAGE  Fell apart in less than 4 years  Company would not replace defective composter
customer_reviews.text: This composter started to fall apart at about 3 years of age. It is now unusable and company does not care. New owners. Too bad for us. I would not buy this if you are in a humid climate. The pictures tell it all.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon MH

customer_reviews.title: Durability issues
customer_reviews.text: The octagonal disc dividing the chambers is rotating independently of the body which is creating open channels between the two chambers and damaging the foam panels. Also the inside is not really sealed at all and the compost gets in between the metal and foam panels that make up the body. It’s a shame because it composts very well, but it will not last very long.
customer_reviews.author: Colin P. Newbill

customer_reviews.title: Incredible
customer_reviews.text: I'm still in the first cycle of composting with this system but it seems to deliver exactly as promised. The bin being seperated in two is a great design idea. It took me five weeks to fill the first bin using my kitchen scraps and green material harvested from the beds around my yard, and shredded brown paper and cardboard. (I purchased an Amazon paper shredder). Now, while filling bin number two, the first load is well on the way to becoming compost. An amazing process!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great and looks great!
customer_reviews.text: This thing works! It makes composting so simple and it sanitizes the process making it possible for an urban or suburban person to do composting without having large smelly unsightly piles lying around in close proximity. Furthermore, due to the highly insulated interior, temperatures get really high and the compost comes out more quickly and more completely finished. It’s not especially easy to assemble-but I watched a video which I stopped and started and had no problems putting it all together with occasional help in certain moments from my wife. It also looks really good in the garden which was part of what we were going for.
customer_reviews.author: Careful and thorough reviewer

customer_reviews.title: 4 year life
customer_reviews.text: This composter works pretty well but it rusted out and is unusable after 4 years outside in dry weather. The door is cracked and falling off. It was easy to use for kitchen waste, but a bit difficult to unload the mulch.
customer_reviews.author: Neil

customer_reviews.title: Working well after three months
customer_reviews.text: This unit composts like a champ. It will be interesting to see how well it holds heat across the mild winters we have, but summer and fall composting it has been breaking down weed grass, wildflower cuttings including semi woody stalks, and kitchen scraps. I have one factory installed screw on a handle which seems to be rusting and assembly was a bit painful, but otherwise it's a great, but pricey, piece of garden kit.
customer_reviews.author: Theodore J. Mallinson

customer_reviews.title: Hard to Assemble - Leaks are Gross
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this unit if you have difficulty building Ikea products. I am reasonably handy and struggled with the assembly. I had to buy some ratchet tie-down straps to get the pieces to align with the screw hole. Also don't expect magic -- this thing takes a while to get going -- after four weeks of use it's still pretty slow going. Although the unit seemed tight, it leaks liquid which is kind of gross. If you're new to composting start with a cheaper unit to see if it make sense for you.
customer_reviews.author: joseph deck

customer_reviews.title: (missing 4 lock nuts - easily obtained) All indication is that it will last at ...
customer_reviews.text: Construction is adequate.(missing 4 lock nuts - easily obtained) All indication is that it will last at least 100 cycles ($4.00 per). Edit: 10/31/17 Must be protected from rain hitting it directly. It helps to position the lid down instead of OCD up. One excellent batch of compost in a relative short period of time and now because of intense rains a soggy "rotten" mess is frozen solid or will be shortly.
customer_reviews.author: Endeavor to perservere

customer_reviews.title: Assembly assistance ideas
customer_reviews.text: Good product but tough assembly. Watched video. First few panels went on but with some difficulty. (Was doing this alone, no help.) Basically, reducing the circumference of the assembly will allow the panel holes to more easily align with the octagonal end plate holes. I used two nylon tie down straps with a ratchet feature, one strap on each end forming a loop around the circumference, ratcheted down. Doesn’t require much force to align holes. Much easier! With only a few panels initially, looping the straps around panels and “axle” will do it.
customer_reviews.author: clipper george

customer_reviews.title: was pretty easy. Packing was excellent and all the parts ...
customer_reviews.text: Putting it together, as far as most things go, was pretty easy. Packing was excellent and all the parts arrived undamaged. The only thing I would add to it before filling is some metal screen material to keep the flies from entering in the summertime. Also, I wouldn't let your compost sit outside before going into the composter. If there is any animal products in there, flies may lay their larve and you will have maggots in the composter and then lots of flies later on. Other than that, my compost is cooking well and I'm excited to use it in the garden.
customer_reviews.author: JOEL HELLESO

customer_reviews.title: Very hard to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Most panels did not fit and were very difficult to assemble. The insulation was too think and thus it was nearly impossible to reach the wholes with screws. As a result, the screws did not quite sit well and the composter leaks a little.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Watch helpful videos on assembly and plan on two people to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: Currently being used for composting for two households. See what happens in a couple months when composting is finished. The height is ideal for loading and I suspect ideal for unloading into wheel barrel . After assemble the unit is extremely sturdy and stable. The grand daughter (2 years) loves spinning it so it is balanced. Two people... It is not hard but aligning and starting screws needs a second set of hands.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Almost impossible to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: This was extremely hard to assemble the the pressure from the foam pieces seals the composter. In order to get a tight seal you have to compress the foam and it does NOT want to compress. Buyer beware you need brute strength to assemble this composter. That said, once I completed it I was very happy with the end result.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Very difficult to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Need two people at a minimum to assemble and it will still be hard to get the last few plates screwed on. The foam liners make it hard to get the parts to fit together to line up the screw holes. We finally got it with 3 ratchet straps (tie downs) to squeeze everything together which scratched and dented a few of the plates. If i produces compost as well as they say it does it won't matter in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this composter
customer_reviews.text: I love this composter!!! It is important to note here...it's going to take you awhile to put this thing together!!! With that said, this is an extremely sturdy composter and so amazingly easy to use. No more stirring compost and it's great to see just how quickly I get wonderful dark compost. Easy to open up and throw daily compost and yard waste in, spin and walk away. Worth the money and effort.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Makes great compost
customer_reviews.text: So far this has been a great tumbler. The only issue I am having is that the foam panels have all shrunk a bit. Now when I open up the door, they do not stay in place unless I carefully hold them. I wish they didn't shrink on me.
customer_reviews.author: D. Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful unit
customer_reviews.text: This has only been in operation about a week, so no feedback on compost yet. However, the item is beautifully designed and solid. I would suggest that you also purchase some wood pellets (cat litter) to add if you don't have enough brown items or the smell will be awful. One small part was damaged, but did not affect the assembly and I have not contacted seller for replacement yet, so I cannot comment on that process either.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Rusts out and falls apart
customer_reviews.text: Works great but completely rusted out after 6 years. I have to throw it away . The insulated design is excellent for cold winters. Body needs to be plastic or aluminum.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Viau

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This product was exactly as described. It is very well made and assembling was easy as well; there are videos on assembly that are very easy to follow. It is helpful to have two people for some of the assembly but not impossible to do alone.
customer_reviews.author: jasmine l pinto

customer_reviews.title: Great tumbler.
customer_reviews.text: Assembled easily, Heavy duty, tumbles smoothly. So far no issue whatsoever. Weather too cool to heat material right now but that will change soon.
customer_reviews.author: Yardboy

customer_reviews.title: This composter is amazing. My only issue is that compost gets between ...
customer_reviews.text: This composter is amazing. My only issue is that compost gets between the insulation and the metal.
customer_reviews.author: mslorraine101

customer_reviews.title: Assembly was challenging but we are so happy with this composted
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was challenging but we are so happy with this composted! Works like a champ and is easy to turn. Makes compost fast!
customer_reviews.author: I4media

customer_reviews.title: I recommend watching a youtube video on how to put together ...
customer_reviews.text: I recommend watching a youtube video on how to put together while reading the instructions. It really helped having both, I don't think I could done it without either. I am 10 days into my first compost and it is getting warmer and breaking down every day. I am very glad that I made the investment
customer_reviews.author: Dan Thwaites

customer_reviews.title: A long time Composer.
customer_reviews.text: Although l looked at the assembly diagram upside down and backwards and missed an assembly step which resulted in having to remove all of the side panels to align the hole patterns in the two plastic center panels. In the end it all went together nicely. Had I been more careful during my first try, l would have had no problems. Also, our Joraform was delivered two days earlier than predicted without any dings or dents. I would recommend this composer. A happy customer.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald A. Pfaff

customer_reviews.title: The composter was easy to assemble in about 1 hour
customer_reviews.text: The composter was easy to assemble in about 1 hour. I have had it for a month and it works great. I highly recommend it to anyone interested in composting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy construction. Simple to turn and compost
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy construction. Simple to turn and compost. Helps me keep four legged critters out of the compost pile.
customer_reviews.author: Johnathan P Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Appears to do a great job; however
customer_reviews.text: Appears to do a great job; however, it leaks black compost liquid from the seams where the panels meet. Some of the screws attaching the handles are rusting, while others are not.
customer_reviews.author: KiwiMarb

customer_reviews.title: Love this composter
customer_reviews.text: After adding some wood pellets to my vegetables in the composter, things really started to heat up and “cook”. The first bin is almost ready to be emptied. Nice earthy smell to the dirt.
customer_reviews.author: Hal P

customer_reviews.title: Great composter,
customer_reviews.text: assembly will be more doable if you have a 2nd person assisting
customer_reviews.author: Louis Tellez Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Filled the first side over a few weeks, and started on the second. In two days the first side cooked down 50% in volume. In January.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Madden

customer_reviews.title: This is the vbst compost bin and works as described ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the vbst compost bin and works as described. If you can afford it then by all means buy it.
customer_reviews.author: tonaz

customer_reviews.title: Great for suburbia
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Make sure to look up the assembly video on YouTube and use an electric screwdriver. Forget the inclosed assembly directions. Great design. After only 2 months, my compost is already starting to look nice and brown like rich dirt
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Wiman

customer_reviews.title: Assembly was terrible, directions were not clear
customer_reviews.text: What we were looking for, will work for us. Assembly was terrible, directions were not clear, only pictures. Should have an instruction manual.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely wonderful. makes compost faster than the other two ways ...
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely wonderful. makes compost faster than the other two ways I'm trying to use. This is the best, fastest way.
customer_reviews.author: Virgil Hall

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Clean, easy to turn, and processes compost much faster than outside.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Joraform Compost Tumbler JK 270
customer_reviews.text: The unit is well constructed. Took a long timeto assemble. The directions are accurate, you have to follow them word for word. Assembly might have benefitted from better drawings. There were a couple of surface scratches on the unit and one panel was dented at the corner. Cosmetic and did not affect performance.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Kaiser

customer_reviews.title: IT IS WORTH THE MONEY
customer_reviews.text: If you want a tumbling composter that actually works this is it. It is insulated and it holds the heat of the decomposing materials in. I have no doubt that it is 160 degrees F and maintained in there. The tumbler came to us without dents and all of the fastners to assemble it. The instructions are best laid out side by side, that is: parts list, step series to assemble, and diagrams. It will take 2 people to assemble it in about 1 hour plus or minus. Well worth the money whichever size Joraform you get.
customer_reviews.author: James Love

customer_reviews.title: Christmas present
customer_reviews.text: I got this present for my husband for Christmas. He was looking at them for a long time, but never ordered it. He was so excited! We followed the online video to assemble it, and there were no problems at all! We are looking forward to great compost soon!
customer_reviews.author: Debra Yeager

customer_reviews.title: Works just like advertised. Accurate & adequate instructions
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly. Everything I needed was in the kit except for the extra pair of hands I needed to hang the doors. Works just like advertised. Accurate & adequate instructions. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Produces compost just like it advertises. Wish I would have gotten the bigger one now! Easy to use and easy to turn. Was a big hard to put together, the instructions were sometimes confusing. I would recommend to others..
customer_reviews.author: Philip Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Very well built
customer_reviews.text: A little more difficult to assemble than I expected. It is well built, and I expect to use it for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome..
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome....everyone who has reviewed was right..the directions are useless...but the YOUTUBE video works perfectly for putting it together...it's easier with two people...also it's prettier than it looks in the pictures...well made sturdy...it's winter and I just got it so I don't know how well it composts, but it looks GREAT in my back yard!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. C

customer_reviews.title: love it!  having fun getting a bit more green in my life!
customer_reviews.text: easy to use, very stable, built well, spins easy directions a bit of a challenge, but went slow, comes together easy
customer_reviews.author: Joanne Vollmer

customer_reviews.title: Jorafor Compost Tumbler
customer_reviews.text: PITA to put together. Had to go to u-tube for instructions to see it put together. If one can put together better than me. Even my wife and I could not finish the final step. Had to call over several friends to finish. Instructions were poor!
customer_reviews.author: Charles Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Assembly is quite easy. works as expected
customer_reviews.text: arrived promptly and not damaged. Assembly is quite easy. works as expected.
customer_reviews.author: sebastien weyland

customer_reviews.title: Love this composter
customer_reviews.text: I do love it. I'm a 77 year old woman and I put together myself with my son's help only to tighten bolts on opposite ends. It is easy to turn and one can two batches "cooking" at different stages. Great invention!
customer_reviews.author: S. B. Dirksen

customer_reviews.title: Great composter, but...
customer_reviews.text: it should be packaged better. A little beat up when it arrived but got it straightened out OK and it went together like it should. That aside, this thing WORKS. Will prolly get another one next year.
customer_reviews.author: John Tricola

customer_reviews.title: I found the product to be high quality and easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I found the product to be high quality and easy to assemble. It might be easier with 2 people during some of the process. After assembly I started loading it and was making compost within a week. I would definately recommend it to friends.
customer_reviews.author: douglas dickens

customer_reviews.title: Damaged in Delivery
customer_reviews.text: We just received the composter and it appears to be built pretty stoutly, but the ends on two sides were crunched in during shipping. It will probably allow a certain amount of composting material to fall out when we rotate it. If I had purchased it locally I would return it for an replacement, but the boxes are so big and bulky that I just don't think I want to go through the hassle of repacking and mailing it back. Too bad.....it's definitely a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: FutureHippy

customer_reviews.title: Fast compost - almost monthly
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy, It'll take two people over a beer to assemble. Made me realize how wasteful I've been, now we give nutrients back into our organic garden and not the landfill, drain etc. Our kids see the value in organic vegetables and doing their part. These are some of the issues you may see in any compost: - Compost may leak a bit if green/brown is imbalanced so put something under to catch as picture shows w/ occasional bleach water. - If you have ant problem grease the legs a bit with engine oil - Other than that keep it shut and odor/critter free!
customer_reviews.author: thumbtaeck

customer_reviews.title: Great composter, assembly difficult unless you re-drill holes to make them bigger
customer_reviews.text: Great composter once you get it put together. A tip on assembly. Screwing the panels in is close to impossible. This is because the holes that are pre-drilled are not drilled the right size for the screws that are supposed to go in the holes. Poor design. After I re-drilled the holes with a 5/32" drill bit (I drilled bigger holes right on top of the existing holes where the metal screws go), all of a sudden it was significantly easier to assembly and I could easily put the screws in with a screwdriver.
customer_reviews.author: T. Larson

customer_reviews.title: A little tricky to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: It definitely takes two people to assemble as the parts are very tight. Once you get it together it is very snug and holds the contents very well. Still learning how to use and make compost in the best possible way. We chose to keep ours outside so the smell wouldn't be a problem. It only smells when it is open. We are enjoying the learning process.
customer_reviews.author: Mama B

customer_reviews.title: This is hands down the best compost tumbler
customer_reviews.text: This is hands down the best compost tumbler. I had another which rusted and did not hold heat. This does! It is solid and well built. It is not hard to tumble even when you have the compost ready. It gets heavy. Two compartments are great but I fill mine up fast. It will take a couple of hours and two people to put it together. Instructions are crap but the company has a great video on YouTube on how to put it together. It was actually kinda fun. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: LM

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely awesome! I have found it so successful because I can quickly add all of the composting materials, turn it oh, leave it as needed. I've only had it a couple of months so I'm not ready to spread the compost yet but it's really looking good!
customer_reviews.author: Sandi

customer_reviews.title: Very high quality compost bin. Easy to turn. Keeps compost toasty all winter.
customer_reviews.text: Pain in the butt to put together, but very sturdy. Has been keeping the compost plenty warm all winter so that it is processing very quickly. My 70 year old aunt finds it really easy to open the sturdy latches and to turn when she takes the compost out if I'm not around. I need to put a catch pan under it as the compost tea drips out of the seams, but that is a minor thing. This thing will last for decades, I'm sure.
customer_reviews.author: AnnieK

customer_reviews.title: Easy and fun to use
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty impressive way to create compost for the garden. The contents get pretty hot making the process relatively quick. The company was nice enough to send me extra hardware as I lost it during a move. With reassembly, I did lose some tightness in some of the joints over the years, but I have had to break it down and reassemble a couple times due to moving.
customer_reviews.author: M. Morris

customer_reviews.title: A very high quality item.
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best composter out there. Be aware that you really need to have a drip tray under both chambers as it drips "liquid gold", which you can save and pour on your garden. Assembly is straight forward, but my wife wouldn't have been able to do it herself. Requires a bit of mechanical know-how. But not much. A great composter that really works.
customer_reviews.author: Busy Tiger

customer_reviews.title: Best composted on the market
customer_reviews.text: It was tough to assemble single handed, but once it is installed, you can’t beat it. Check out John Collier’s channel on YouTube called “Growing your greens” he does a few videos on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy a GEOBIN instead.
customer_reviews.text: Expensive and the foam shrinks with the heat. They also start rusting when the enamel peels off. Not worth it. They aren’t even big enough to heat up properly. Stick with GEOBINS.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Great Product and Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a Jora Composter 6 years ago. It is the best composter on the market. I recently had a concern with the composter and the Customer Service Representative Tom, handled the concern without any hesitation and expertise. Not only is the PR great at Composting Warehouse but the Jora Composter is the best!!
customer_reviews.author: Stanley Ruskow

customer_reviews.title: I'm a big fan
customer_reviews.text: This composter is lovely. Setup was daunting but my husband and I took about 2 hrs with a cordless drill and watched the Eartheasy setup video to go through the steps. Have been using since last Aug and really happy with it. We're in a city and this doesn't attract rats at all.
customer_reviews.author: Gretchen

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy and Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: Great! Very Sturdy. We haven't actually used it yet but I'm sure it will work great!
customer_reviews.author: Bernadette

customer_reviews.title: Works great, and looks good too.
customer_reviews.text: Works great, and looks good too. A beast to put together, but worth it. Good and sturdy. Makes composting really easy. Having two compartments is helpful so you can start a newer collection when an older one is nearly ready for use.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Camhi

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality checks
customer_reviews.text: The first unit I purchased, it had scrapes all along the exterior the doors did not fit correctly. The second unit I purchased after returning the 1st comma it completely missed having a separate set of holes on one of the exterior panels. I'm in the process of either returning it or getting a replacement part. Very very poor quality checks! Very poor quality checks
customer_reviews.author: sean m. warden

customer_reviews.title: love it!
customer_reviews.text: ok.. this thing is awesome!! it got up to composting temp in less than a week... it does take two people to put together.. it is amazing!! so much better than any other composter!! worth the money
customer_reviews.author: J. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Super composter
customer_reviews.text: The assemble was a bit hard but worth the labor as this composter is by far the best for urban composting. I used only food scraps in the beginning but found it to be too smelly and it also leaked a bit. After adding a small bag of grass clippings into it, the smell was gone and no leaks. Great product 10/10
customer_reviews.author: Mubarak Al-Tobaishi

customer_reviews.title: Awesome machine
customer_reviews.text: This is the best composter I've owned. Once I covered the vents, it even started to kind of work in the winter but it could be better. The rest of the year, however, was incredible!
customer_reviews.author: S. Yorton

customer_reviews.title: Best composter on the market
customer_reviews.text: I heard horror stories about the assembly of this product. I don't know if they changed the directions or what but it was really simple. It took my wife, and my two boys and I about 40 minutes to put it together. Just like any product, there are some educated guesses but all in all it was simple. The product was packaged correctly, no damage at all, which is impressive for a heavy item. Started composting the same day. Excellent sturdy composter. Hint: we slipped a bit of fine mesh screen over the air vents to keep bees out.
customer_reviews.author: Trisha G.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome does not begin to tell how great this is.
customer_reviews.author: Jknox

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: It does everything I hoped it would. It's very easy to turn and it's amazing how quickly it has heated up. Every time we open it you can actually see steam coming out!
customer_reviews.author: Eileen Squitiro

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: love this... am on my third 'loading' works really well
customer_reviews.author: cmptrwiz

customer_reviews.title: Joraform Composter is a gardener's hero
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly well built, processes compost quickly within a month to six weeks, without all the mess and smell. Animals cannot access the compost. I am considering buying a second unit, because it's so well constructed and my garden generates a lot of compostable material.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy L Rice

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Machine!
customer_reviews.text: As opposed to some buyers' experiences, our composter arrived carefully packaged in two boxes that were each double boxed. There was no damage. As mentioned before, the directions were challenging. We watched the Eartheasy YouTube video on assembling which was extremely helpful. The only issue I have with the quality is the two side leg braces are not very strong, and in moving the composter to its permanent location with a dolly we bent one of them. Transit after assembly was not addressed in the manual, so I would suggest assembling it close to where it is going to go and making sure the final surface is level. Other than the braces, everything is beautifully made and works well.
customer_reviews.author: Libraryannie

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and works great gets nice and hot
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Quintero

customer_reviews.title: WOW
customer_reviews.text: I won't review it there's plenty of reviews online. Just adding my 5 stars, simply the best composter. I grow oranges and lemons, that's the only composter that will handle citrus FYI. Resist rain/rust!
customer_reviews.author: Tom.B

product_meta.title: Jora Composter Tumbler JK270
product_meta.description: JK 270 Features: -Insulation 2.16'' polyethylene plastic. -Dual chamber lets you keep adding new materials in one bin while other matures. -Reduces and eliminates odors. -Rodent-proof design. -Made out of galvanized steel for longer sustainability. -Constructed for ease and simplicity of rotation. Product Type: -Tumbler. Color: -Forest Green. Hardware Finish: -Stainless Steel. Material: -Metal/Plastic. Hardware Material: -Stainless Steel/Plastic. Dimensions: Overall Product Weight: -84 lbs.
feature_bullets: This tumbling composter is constructed for ease and simplicity of rotation - it's simply turned by hand whenever waste is put in.
The Jora Compost Tumbler is divided into two chambers. While one is being filled, the compost in the other chamber matures.
The Jora Composter is positioned off the ground and the doors are secured with a latch so that there is no possibility of rodents or other pests gaining access to the waste in the machine.
The JK270 has a volume of up to 70 gallons and capacity of 7-8 gallons a week.
The JK 270 Compost tumbler is made from galvanized steel and the barrel is powder-coated to be more durable and longer lasting.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars169 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
specifications.Warranty Description: 2 Year warranty The Composting Warehouse Inc. warrants to the first consumer purchaser, for a period one year from the date of purchase, that this product is free from defects in materials and workmanship. The Composting Warehouse will replace the defective product or part at no charge to the purchaser, provided the unit is assembled, installed and operated in accordance with the written instructions. This warranty does not apply to any damage resulting from accident, misuse, abuse, improper installation, or neglect; nor to any unit that has been altered, modified, or tampered with in any way. This warranty does not cover any incidental or consequential costs or expenses incurred by the use of this product, other than those explicitly stated herein. Within applicable law, no other warranty expressed or implied exists
